page.title: 11Industry in Hoddlesden
page.content: In Hoddlesden there are 2 firms which employ some of the village people.They are both in buildings that used to be cotton mills.The oldest is Vernon Carus which has been in Hoddlesden for 104 years.They make surgical dressings ,nappies etc.They employ 300 people _ 210 women & 90 men.They buy cotton yarn & polythene as raw materials & they export to many countries.Most of their goods are sold to hospitals & the National Health Service. The other firm is called Gordon & Fairclough.They make special coatings for fabrics to make them stronger or waterproof etc.The material is then used for camping equipment such as tents, kagools etc.They also have been involved in some special projects e.g "Sky Quest".They presently employ 34 people in Hoddlesden & 14 in Bury.
